name: Audio 1
transcription: Light snowfall is expected tonight, accumulating up to two inches.

name: Audio 2
transcription: Humidity levels are expected to rise significantly tomorrow morning.

name: Audio 3
transcription: Expect clear skies overnight as a low-pressure system moves eastward.

name: Audio 4
transcription: High-altitude clouds suggest changing weather patterns by Wednesday.

name: Audio 5
transcription: Isolated thunderstorms may develop in the afternoon across central areas.

name: Audio 6
transcription: A mix of sun and clouds is expected, keeping temperatures moderate.

name: Audio 7
transcription: Patchy fog might linger near water bodies early in the morning.

name: Audio 8
transcription: Temperatures will dip slightly below average on Sunday.

name: Audio 9
transcription: Afternoon thundershowers could lead to localized flooding in some areas.

name: Audio 10
transcription: Mist is likely to form in valleys during the overnight hours.

name: Audio 11
transcription: Visibility may be limited due to dense mist in valleys.

name: Audio 12
transcription: Frost is likely on exposed surfaces, despite sunny skies.

name: Audio 13
transcription: Hazy conditions prevail along riverbanks as humidity increases.

name: Audio 14
transcription: Expect rapid temperature drops after sunset.

name: Audio 15
transcription: Heat advisories are in effect with oppressive humidity levels.

name: Audio 16
transcription: Blizzard warnings issued for high-altitude areas overnight.

name: Audio 17
transcription: Expect freezing rain to create slick road conditions.

name: Audio 18
transcription: Morning dew creates a shimmer on grass as dawn breaks.

name: Audio 19
transcription: The temperature is expected to peak just before sunset.

name: Audio 20
transcription: Snowfall tapers off but leaves a thick blanket of white.
